# ü§ù TapMint<!-- generated by @neynar/create-farcaster-mini-app version 1.3.2 -->



**Connect physically, mint digitally.**# Farcaster Eth Mini App Template



TapMint turns real-world connections into NFTs on Base blockchain. Meet someone new? Tap phones, exchange an emoji, and mint a unique "Proof of Connection" NFT.A template for building Farcaster mini apps with Next.js, QuickAuth, and Ethereum integration.



## ‚ú® Features## Getting Started



- üì° **Bluetooth Connection** - Pair devices via Web Bluetooth API1. Use this template to create a new repository

- üì± **NFC Tap** - Quick tap-to-connect on Android2. Clone the repository to your local system:

- üì∑ **QR Code** - Universal QR scanning for any device

- üí´ **Emoji Ping** - Send a unique emoji to commemorate the connection```bash

- üé® **NFT Minting** - Mint proof of connection on Base L2git clone <your-repo-url>

- üåê **IPFS Storage** - Decentralized metadata storagecd <your-repo-name>

```

## üöÄ Quick Start

3. Set up required services:

```bash

# Install dependencies   - **Redis** (Required for notifications / Optional if using Neynar):

npm install

     - Get your URL and Key from [Upstash Console](https://console.upstash.com/redis)

# Run development server     - Used for sending notifications to users

npm run dev

```   - **Neynar API** (Optional):

     - Get your API Key from [Neynar Developer Portal](https://dev.neynar.com/app)

Open [http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000)     - Used for fetching Farcaster data

     - Can be used for notifications if you don't want to use Redis

## üì± How It Works

4. Install dependencies:

1. **Connect Wallet** - Connect your Web3 wallet

2. **Choose Method** - Select Bluetooth, NFC, or QR code```bash

3. **Pair Devices** - Connect with another person's devicenpm install

4. **Exchange Emoji** - Send a unique emoji to each other```

5. **Mint NFT** - Create your proof of connection on Base

5. Run the development server:

## Authentication

### Making Authenticated Requests

1. Import the auth utilities:

```typescript
import { fetchWithAuth } from "~/lib/auth";
```

2. Use `fetchWithAuth` for API calls:

```typescript
// Example API call
const response = await fetchWithAuth("/api/protected-route");
const data = await response.json();
```

### Protected API Routes

1. Import the auth utilities:

```typescript
import { verifyAuth } from "~/lib/auth";
```

2. Verify authentication in your route:

```typescript
export async function GET(request: Request) {
  const auth = await verifyAuth(request);
  if (!auth) {
    return new NextResponse("Unauthorized", { status: 401 });
  }

  // Your protected route logic here
  return NextResponse.json({ fid: auth.fid });
}
```

## Guide

This is made using Neynar's StarterKit [this Neynar docs page](https://docs.neynar.com/docs/create-farcaster-miniapp-in-60s) for a simple guide on how to create a Farcaster Mini App in less than 60 seconds!

## Getting Started

To create a new mini app project, run:

Click on use this template.

To run the project:

```{bash}
cd <PROJECT_NAME>
npm run dev
```

## Building for Production

To create a production build, run:

```{bash}
npm run build
```

The above command will generate a `.env` file based on the `.env.local` file and user input. Be sure to configure those environment variables on your hosting platform.

## Building with AI

AI guide for FC Mini Apps SDK - https://miniapps.farcaster.xyz/docs/getting-started#building-with-ai

AI guide for Neynar - https://docs.neynar.com/docs/neynar-farcaster-with-cursor

## Why MiniApps?

Lets u open Apps inside social feed.
Leverage and build on social Data so add social component to make your app viral.
Send Notifications to retain the users.

Simple flow

- Build your simple App just like u bulid webapps
- Wrap it inside the NeynarProvider (FrameContext) to get the context of the user [username, fid, walletadd, pfp and with fid his entire social graph]
- Access the inbuilt Farcaster Wallet for any onchain activity
